talk.utter: It is still worth noting that blocking from a nuanced disagreement or discourse is dangerous. I've seen it happen here, too. Granted they are anecdotes but I really think people want to shield themselves from disagreement. Which I very much don't relate to

Yes it is, I agree. However I don't see why I, as an individual, I should suffer people I absolutely do not suffer in real life.
This is social media not the gulag.
If you're an arsehole I will block you. Don't care about your political opinion, just your personality.

talk.author: did:plc:ndn2pyfrthpg3bekbflou3t4
talk.utter: I don't know when social media turned into obligatory martyrdom but unless you're a professional journalist, I am not on the side of people who push that narrative.

talk.author: did:plc:ndn2pyfrthpg3bekbflou3t4

Sure. But blocking people that disagree as a pattern is how you make an echo chamber. Haha

Personally, if someone is annoying me I just ignore them. Not like mute them, I just move on. If they are being belligerent, yeah, agreed, that's what block is for.
